etymology.description: Semantic: 月(月) (yuè, 'moon') + Phonetic: 𦣞(𦣞) (unknown) = aspects of the day -> morning
etymology.interpretation: The character 朝(朝) (zhāo, 'morning') combines the semantic component 月(月) (yuè, 'moon') suggesting a time associated with the moon, while the phonetic component 𦣞(𦣞) lends its sound. Together, these elements capture the transition from night to day, or morning.

examples.english: The morning breeze caresses one's face.

examples.chinese: 朝露滋潤花朵(朝露滋潤花朵)。
examples.pinyin: Zhāo lù zī rùn huā duǒ.
examples.english: The morning dew nourishes the flowers.

examples.chinese: 朝霜悄降山野(朝霜悄降山野)，預兆豐收季節(預兆豐收季節)。
examples.pinyin: Zhāo shuāng qiāo jiàng shān yě, yù zhào fēng shōu jì jié.
examples.english: The morning frost silently falls on the mountains and fields, signaling a season of abundant harvest.
